scope_of_work.problem: The NHBR HV switchgear battery tripping supplies are approaching 5 years in service and are due for replacement (5 year cycle).
scope_of_work.scope: Replacement of all NHBR HV switchgear battery tripping supplies. 90 in total.
scope_of_work.justification: The NHBR battery tripping supplies are an essential item of the site infrastructure. The battery tripping supplies ensure the HV system can continue to operate as designed during extended periods of main supply interuption.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased operational/resilience risk to the NHBR IT load. Increased health and safety risk to the NHBR site operations team.

project_name: UPM-Socomec A1 & B1 fans (4 year cycle)
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Marge Hills (2):offer submitted by Marge Hills (3):work in progress by Marge Hills

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The fans in the Socomec UPS A1 & B1 are now due for replacement after 4 years in service as recommended by the OEM (Socomec) as they are end of life.
scope_of_work.scope:
Replacement of fans in Socomec UPS A1 & B1

Fans to be Replaced:
E1704684 - 4No.
E17047820 - 20No.
E9108676 - 6No.
scope_of_work.justification: It has been identified and agreed that these fans are required to be  replaced after 4 years service this aligns with the OEM's recommended replacement parts life cycle.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased risk to the site critical IT load. Fans will run to failure and cause functional issues with the UPS systems resulting in the UPS systems failing to operate as designed.

project_name: UPM-FET 5 Yearly Remedial - Cooling Tower Lighting DB & Circuitry
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: We recently carried out our 5 yearly FET testing on site, In the Condenser Pump house the External lighting distribution board has been condemned. This now results in us not being able to use the external lights which cover the cooling towers, cooling tower gantry. these area's require to be lit for night working (call out) as their are low level pipework, pumps and other obstacles with the working at height along gantry sections. deterioration  of the cabling has also been detected with the environment they run in so they also require rewiring from alternate Distribution Board along light fittings.
scope_of_work.scope:
Utilise alternate existing distribution board  pull in 2 new circuits and replace unsafe lights with new lights around  cooling tower's and gantry.

Carry out all required Electrical Testing works for the completed remedial task  to current BS7671:2018 AMND 2.
scope_of_work.justification:
Now the Distribution Board has been condemned during the FET Testing, The lack of lighting around the staircase, the  high level gantry and the gantry walkways, have failed on all parts from cabling, light fittings and the distribution board that it is fed from  being labelled as unsafe for use . This has become a heath and safety issue regarding plant checks, maintenance and call outs to the cooling towers once the daylight hours fade.
This could cause an accident as the gantry is a raised area around 25 feet above ground level, their are also low level pipework in the area's which could also cause injury if their is not sufficient lighting available.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Health and safety issue, high chance at night on call out,  personal injury could happen due to the lack of lighting. risk of failure to equipment and circuits, worst case scenario risk of fire due to overload/overheating or serious injury to operative.

associated_items: the assositated items with their boolean values are mentioned: As Builts (No), EANS/CMMS Update (No), O&M Manuals (No), Job Punch List (No), Health & Safety Form (EPIC Form) (No), Single Source Approval (No), Close-Out Checklist (Yes)

project_name: UPM-Server rack removal from HW1 - removal of door swing arms and fittings.
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Server racks to be moved from HW1 are too high to go through the automatic doors, the door swing arms and fittings fall below the door frame causing an obstruction.
scope_of_work.scope: Contractor to attend site to remove Automatic Door fixings that fall below the door jamb to allow server racks to be taken out of HW1 through doors , contractor to attend site when job finished to reinstall fittings and commission.
scope_of_work.justification: For the safe removal of the server racks the door fittings must be removed to allow space for the racks to pass below the door.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Server racks to remain in HW1, job failed.

project_name: UPM-.Removal of door mechanisms to allow server racks to pass through.
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
As part of the shutting down of the IRS space at Kyndryl Warwick, during investigative works to safely plan the removal of redundant server racks from HW1, it was discovered the safest route would be to go through the double doors leading from reception into the corridor. 

With the door fittings and swing arms in place attempting to remove the racks via this route would cause damage to the fittings on the door, making the door inoperable. Removing the fittings from the doors would allow the racks to pass under without causing damage.
scope_of_work.scope: Contractor to attend site 8am and remove the door swing arms and fittings from the double doors leading from reception, allowing the HWIP team to remove the redundant server racks safely below the door frame. Following removal of all racks from HW1 the contractor will re-attend the Warwick site  same day to re-assemble and commission ensuring both doors open and close as they should.
scope_of_work.justification:
The safest route to remove the racks from the HW1 suite would be via the reception doors 

These servers are to be removed to assist in shutting down IRS space at Kyndryl Warwick.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Server racks can not be removed and will remain in HW1, causing delays in the project for shutting down the IRS areas at the Warwick location.
